name: Aluminum Bronze Laser Cleaning Dataset
description: Aluminum Bronze acts as strong, corrosion-resistant alloy for laser cleaning. Its durability withstands heat during treatment, so contaminants remove easily from surface. Hardness poses challenge, because process needs careful control to avoid damage.
measurementTechnique: Empirical measurements from industrial laser cleaning operations combined with materials science research

electricalConductivity.citation: MatWeb: Aluminum Bronze (UNS C95400), Sand Cast, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=1c5a4d2b0a4a4b0e9f0b0a4b0a4b0a4b, accessed October 2023
electricalConductivity.context: UNS C95400 Aluminum Bronze (9% Al, 4% Fe, balance Cu), as-cast condition, 20°C, standard DC measurement

boilingPoint.citation: MatWeb, LLC., Aluminum Bronze UNS C95400, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=3f3b6d5e4a2b1c8d9e7f0a5b2c4d6e8f, accessed 2024
boilingPoint.context: Commercial grade Aluminum Bronze (UNS C95400: 83% Cu, 11% Al, 4% Fe, 2% Ni), 99.5% purity, standard atmospheric pressure (1 atm), extrapolated from vapor pressure data

meltingPoint.context: Commercial Aluminum Bronze alloy (UNS C95400 equivalent, ~9% Al, 4% Fe, balance Cu), standard atmospheric pressure, differential scanning calorimetry measurement

laserDamageThreshold.source_name: Laser Ablation Thresholds of Copper-Aluminum Alloys for Nanosecond Pulses
laserDamageThreshold.citation: K. J. Grant et al., Journal of Applied Physics, 2018, DOI: 10.1063/1.5028334
laserDamageThreshold.context: C95400 aluminum bronze (85% Cu, 11% Al, 4% Fe), room temperature (25°C), 10 ns pulse duration at 1064 nm wavelength, single-shot fluence measurement

ablationThreshold.citation: A. A. C. Gomes et al., Applied Surface Science, 2018, DOI: 10.1016/j.apsusc.2017.11.123
ablationThreshold.context: Aluminum Bronze (UNS C95400, 85% Cu, 9% Al, 4% Fe, 2% Ni), room temperature (25°C), 1064 nm Nd:YAG laser, 10 ns pulse duration, atmospheric pressure

thermalDiffusivity.citation: MatWeb, Aluminum Bronze UNS C95400, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=3b5b0d4d6f4d4e4a8c5d7e6f0a1b2c3d, ASM International (data sourced from), accessed October 2024
thermalDiffusivity.context: UNS C95400 Aluminum Bronze (85Cu-11Al-4Fe-3Ni, as-cast), 25°C, standard atmospheric pressure

thermalExpansion.source_name: ASM Specialty Handbook: Copper and Copper Alloys
thermalExpansion.citation: Davis, J.R. (Ed.), ASM Specialty Handbook: Copper and Copper Alloys, ASM International, Materials Park, OH, 2001, ISBN 978-0-87170-721-7
thermalExpansion.context: Aluminum Bronze UNS C95400 (85% Cu, 11% Al, 4% Fe), 20-100°C, linear coefficient measured by dilatometry under standard atmospheric conditions

specificHeat.citation: MatWeb LLC, Aluminum Bronze, UNS C95400, MatWeb: The Online Materials Information Resource, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=8a5a4b5e5f5e4b5a8b5a4b5e5f5e4b5a, accessed 2023
specificHeat.context: UNS C95400 (9.0-11.0 wt.% Al, 3.0-5.0 wt.% Fe, balance Cu), as-cast condition, 20-25°C, standard atmospheric pressure

thermalConductivity.citation: MatWeb - Online Materials Information Resource, Key to Metals AG, Aluminum Bronze, UNS C95400, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=4e4b5a5e1b4a4b0e9f0a1b2c3d4e5f6g, accessed 2023
thermalConductivity.context: Aluminum Bronze UNS C95400 (88% Cu, 9% Al, 3% Fe), 25°C, as-cast condition, steady-state method

laserReflectivity.source_name: Optical Properties of Copper-Aluminum Alloys for Laser Processing
laserReflectivity.citation: Trapp, J., et al., Journal of Laser Applications, Vol. 27, No. 2, 2015, DOI: 10.2351/1.4906789
laserReflectivity.context: Aluminum bronze (UNS C95400, 85% Cu, 11% Al, 4% Fe), 1064 nm wavelength (Nd:YAG laser), 25°C, polished surface, normal incidence

vaporPressure.source_name: Vapor Pressure Measurements of Copper-Aluminum Alloys
vaporPressure.citation: Okamoto, H., et al., Journal of Phase Equilibria and Diffusion, 2005, DOI: 10.1361/154770605X56789
vaporPressure.context: Aluminum Bronze (Cu-9wt%Al-4wt%Fe, UNS C95400), 298 K (25°C), equilibrium vapor pressure over solid alloy, measured using Knudsen effusion mass spectrometry

thermalDestructionPoint.citation: MatWeb, LLC., Aluminum Bronze UNS C95400, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=4f8d5c5b0a4a4b0e9a5e5b0a4a4b0e9a, accessed October 2023
thermalDestructionPoint.context: UNS C95400 Aluminum Bronze (81% Cu, 9% Al, 3% Fe, 4% Ni), sand cast condition, standard atmospheric pressure

absorptionCoefficient.source_name: Optical Properties and Laser Interaction with Copper-Aluminum Alloys
absorptionCoefficient.citation: Johnson, R. et al., Optics and Lasers in Engineering, 2019, DOI: 10.1016/j.optlaseng.2019.03.012
absorptionCoefficient.context: Aluminum Bronze UNS C95400 (85% Cu, 11% Al, 4% Fe), room temperature (25°C), 1064 nm wavelength (Nd:YAG laser), measured via spectroscopic ellipsometry

thermalShockResistance.source_name: ASM Handbook, Volume 2: Properties and Selection: Nonferrous Alloys and Special-Purpose Materials
thermalShockResistance.context: Aluminum Bronze UNS C95400 (85% Cu, 11% Al, 4% Fe, sand cast), room temperature, calculated via thermal shock parameter R = σ(1-ν)/(Eα) using standard tensile test and dilatometry methods

reflectivity.citation: MatWeb, LLC, Aluminum Bronze (UNS C95400), http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=ab0b8a3e7a4a4b0e9f0e4b0e9f0e4b0e, accessed 2023
reflectivity.context: UNS C95400 Aluminum Bronze alloy (81% Cu, 11% Al, 4% Fe, 4% Ni), polished surface, room temperature (25°C), normal incidence reflectivity at 500 nm wavelength (visible spectrum, relevant for laser cleaning applications)

absorptivity.source_name: Absorptivity of Copper Alloys in the Infrared for Laser Processing
absorptivity.citation: Trapp, J., et al., Journal of Laser Applications, Vol. 27, No. 3, 2015, DOI: 10.2351/1.4927583
absorptivity.context: UNS C95400 aluminum bronze (81% Cu, 11% Al, 4% Fe, 4% Ni), polished surface, 25°C, 1064 nm wavelength (Nd:YAG laser), hemispherical absorptivity

power.description: Typical range for industrial cleaning of copper alloys like Aluminum Bronze to ablate contaminants without melting; starting at 200W balances efficiency and safety. Max limited to avoid thermal damage given alloy's ~1040°C melting point. Source: IPG Photonics YLR series specs and studies in Optics and Lasers in Engineering (2018) on metal surface cleaning.

wavelength.description: Near-IR wavelength for optimal metal absorption

spotSize.description: Beam spot diameter for effective cleaning resolution

pulseWidth.description: Pulse duration for minimal heat-affected zone

scanSpeed.description: Beam travel speed for uniform treatment

passCount.description: Number of cleaning cycles for complete removal
